intro: Rabdosia kangtingensis, commonly known as Kangting Rabdosia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for taxonomists and botanists studying plant diversity.
